comment:
* @hide * Class to represent the attributes of an audio device: its type (speaker, headset...), address * (if known) and role (input, output). *

Unlike {@link AudioDeviceInfo}, the device * doesn't need to be connected to be uniquely identified, it can * for instance represent a specific A2DP headset even after a * disconnection, whereas the corresponding AudioDeviceInfo * would then be invalid. *

While creating / obtaining an instance is not protected by a * permission, APIs using one rely on MODIFY_AUDIO_ROUTING.

variables.name: ROLE_INPUT
variables.comment: * A role identifying input devices, such as microphones.

variables.name: ROLE_OUTPUT
variables.comment: * A role identifying output devices, such as speakers or headphones.

variables.name: mType
variables.comment: * The audio device type, as defined in {@link AudioDeviceInfo}

variables.name: mAddress
variables.comment: * The unique address of the device. Some devices don't have addresses, only an empty string.

methods.name: public int getRole()
methods.comment:
* @hide
     * Returns the role of a device
     * @return the role

methods.name: public int getType()
public String getAddress()
methods.comment:
* @hide
     * Returns the address of the audio device, or an empty string for devices without one
     * @return the device address

methods.name: public static String roleToString(@Role int role)
public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public static String roleToString(@Role int role)
public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
